comment.body:
@zloyden I'm sorry if I'm doing it wrong, but I thought it would be better to try to reopen this issue than to create a duplicate.

I believe it was not possible to reproduce, because if you access this server directly, without going through POSTs and redirects, you end up accessing a "facade" website.

If you access [this link](https://www.hinatasoul.com/videos/359452), click on the player and wait for all the redirects, you will arrive at the domain indicated in the first post.
<details>
  <summary>Screenshots</summary>

![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/31132223/a86338a3-6c03-4894-abb6-013ce679d2ae)
![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/31132223/f3378e53-0fe5-43dc-820f-fbf0cff58447)
![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/31132223/758e3612-f420-4cde-9f1f-aaa5e7889bf0)
</details>

To try and help, below is what happens on the page:
1. The page loads normally with the player.
2. The div containing the "warp" class is deleted.
3. The div containing the "detectadb" class is edited, adding the "display: block" style.

Until then, I have been running the following code in the console to prevent Anti-Adblock from getting in the way.
```javascript
$("div.wrap").attr('class', '');
$("div.detectadb").remove();
```
I read the documentation, but I don't know the best way to deal with the part about removing the "warp" class.

pull_request.title: Attempted to improve close-out of Regex dots
pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

None at the moment, as reports.adguard.com has no options for any scenarios like this.

### Enter the issue address

None at the moment, as reports.adguard.com has no options for any scenarios like this.

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

1. Your comment

I had noticed that some entries had unclosed .'s in RegEx entries, in particular in cases where one would normally expect them to be enclosed unless there's something I'm currently unaware of, such as domain names and when leading into file extensions. So I attempted to fix that in this PR.

2. Screenshots

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/22780683/14c91290-daaf-457b-9ab1-6810e9af8e69)

</details>

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

Когда Adguard включен, то на сайте https://diamant.ua/ru/catalog/ при использовании фильтров мы получаем страницу без результатов и только при повторной перезагрузке страницы результаты фильтрации видны и мы видим товары. Когда Adguard выключен, все работает исправно, то есть мы выбрали любые фильтра, применили их и видим товары результатов фильтрации. Такой проблемы ранее не было. Нужно решить ее. ### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://x.com/PETEandrepete_/status/1788379241815445981](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fx.com%2FPETEandrepete_%2Fstatus%2F1788379241815445981) ### Comment > I use the app “Downie” https://software.charliemonroe.net/downie/ to download audio, video, and images from various websites. One such was of starting a download is to paste the URL of a page that contains the item you want to download. > > This works 100% of the time for everything EXCEPT Twitter. Excuse me, X.com. > > So say I want to download this gif of a tornado that I just tweeted. The URL is https://x.com/PETEandrepete_/status/1788379241815445981 and pasting this directly into Downie will cause an error "Error: Cannot find configuration URL.” > > If the URL is simply changed to https://twitter.com/PETEandrepete_/status/1788379241815445981 then it downloads perfectly. > > This ONLY happens when AdGuard is running. Disable it and you can now use either x.com or twitter.com URLs. > > A while back I THOUGHT i had nailed this down as being related to DNS Protection, which i had been using at the time. Seems like when I changed it or disabled it the problem went away, however that is not the case as of now. So the only workaround is to change the URL manually. It's hard to say what causes problem without being able to reproduce it.
You can try to disable all filter lists and then check if issue still occurs.
If not, then you can try to enable them one by one until there will be a problem with log in again.

comment.body:
It didn't change anything... but I found the problem as I was looking more into the stealth mode:

I tried disabling some privacy extensions, too... changed nothing.

But I think the site is a pos (and the only one not working right so far), anyways, so we shouldn't invest too much effort. It works without AdGuard (most of the time...) and the site has no ads (only tracking, but there are other ways around _that_).

labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://apps.shopify.com/gdpr-cookie-consent](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fapps.shopify.com%2Fgdpr-cookie-consent) ### Comment > I'm Alex from the Pandectes GDPR compliance app for Shopify. > We are currently the most popular app for Consent Management on the Shopify app store, and I am contacting you for an issue that our customers are facing on their stores. We have over 30.000 active stores and there is a large portion of store owners that use the "overlay" position for their cookie banner and are affected by this block. The overlay position by design hides the page content by adding an opaque div and blocking scrolling. When the banner div is removed by your app from the DOM, a user cannot interact with the store, and cannot scroll at all, providing a poor experience for our mutual customers. Username: `@ZagrebaAlex` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/hwsk2ox6heogw88wo0gw0oc0osk8ssg79uug9o4dlk.png?nc=1)

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://x.com/PETEandrepete_/status/1788379241815445981](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fx.com%2FPETEandrepete_%2Fstatus%2F1788379241815445981) ### Comment > I use the app “Downie” https://software.charliemonroe.net/downie/ to download audio, video, and images from various websites. One such was of starting a download is to paste the URL of a page that contains the item you want to download. > > This works 100% of the time for everything EXCEPT Twitter. Excuse me, X.com. > > So say I want to download this gif of a tornado that I just tweeted. The URL is https://x.com/PETEandrepete_/status/1788379241815445981 and pasting this directly into Downie will cause an error "Error: Cannot find configuration URL.” > > If the URL is simply changed to https://twitter.com/PETEandrepete_/status/1788379241815445981 then it downloads perfectly. > > This ONLY happens when AdGuard is running. Disable it and you can now use either x.com or twitter.com URLs. > > A while back I THOUGHT i had nailed this down as being related to DNS Protection, which i had been using at the time. Seems like when I changed it or disabled it the problem went away, however that is not the case as of now. So the only workaround is to change the URL manually. Username: `@petekjohnson` ### Screenshots

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://x.com/PETEandrepete_/status/1788379241815445981](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fx.com%2FPETEandrepete_%2Fstatus%2F1788379241815445981) ### Comment > I use the app “Downie” https://software.charliemonroe.net/downie/ to download audio, video, and images from various websites. One such was of starting a download is to paste the URL of a page that contains the item you want to download. > > This works 100% of the time for everything EXCEPT Twitter. Excuse me, X.com. > > So say I want to download this gif of a tornado that I just tweeted. The URL is https://x.com/PETEandrepete_/status/1788379241815445981 and pasting this directly into Downie will cause an error "Error: Cannot find configuration URL.” > > If the URL is simply changed to https://twitter.com/PETEandrepete_/status/1788379241815445981 then it downloads perfectly. > > This ONLY happens when AdGuard is running. Disable it and you can now use either x.com or twitter.com URLs. > > A while back I THOUGHT i had nailed this down as being related to DNS Protection, which i had been using at the time. Seems like when I changed it or disabled it the problem went away, however that is not the case as of now. So the only workaround is to change the URL manually. Username: `@petekjohnson` ### Screenshots

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://apps.shopify.com/gdpr-cookie-consent](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fapps.shopify.com%2Fgdpr-cookie-consent) ### Comment > I'm Alex from the Pandectes GDPR compliance app for Shopify. > We are currently the most popular app for Consent Management on the Shopify app store, and I am contacting you for an issue that our customers are facing on their stores. We have over 30.000 active stores and there is a large portion of store owners that use the "overlay" position for their cookie banner and are affected by this block. The overlay position by design hides the page content by adding an opaque div and blocking scrolling. When the banner div is removed by your app from the DOM, a user cannot interact with the store, and cannot scroll at all, providing a poor experience for our mutual customers. Username: `@ZagrebaAlex` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/hwsk2ox6heogw88wo0gw0oc0osk8ssg79uug9o4dlk.png?nc=1)

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://x.com/PETEandrepete_/status/1788379241815445981](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fx.com%2FPETEandrepete_%2Fstatus%2F1788379241815445981) ### Comment > I use the app “Downie” https://software.charliemonroe.net/downie/ to download audio, video, and images from various websites. One such was of starting a download is to paste the URL of a page that contains the item you want to download. > > This works 100% of the time for everything EXCEPT Twitter. Excuse me, X.com. > > So say I want to download this gif of a tornado that I just tweeted. The URL is https://x.com/PETEandrepete_/status/1788379241815445981 and pasting this directly into Downie will cause an error "Error: Cannot find configuration URL.” > > If the URL is simply changed to https://twitter.com/PETEandrepete_/status/1788379241815445981 then it downloads perfectly. > > This ONLY happens when AdGuard is running. Disable it and you can now use either x.com or twitter.com URLs. > > A while back I THOUGHT i had nailed this down as being related to DNS Protection, which i had been using at the time. Seems like when I changed it or disabled it the problem went away, however that is not the case as of now. So the only workaround is to change the URL manually. Username: `@petekjohnson` ### Screenshots

comment.body:
Not reproduced on my end.
Try to clear browser data, update the filters (wait almost one minute there), open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://x.com/PETEandrepete_/status/1788379241815445981](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fx.com%2FPETEandrepete_%2Fstatus%2F1788379241815445981) ### Comment > I use the app “Downie” https://software.charliemonroe.net/downie/ to download audio, video, and images from various websites. One such was of starting a download is to paste the URL of a page that contains the item you want to download. > > This works 100% of the time for everything EXCEPT Twitter. Excuse me, X.com. > > So say I want to download this gif of a tornado that I just tweeted. The URL is https://x.com/PETEandrepete_/status/1788379241815445981 and pasting this directly into Downie will cause an error "Error: Cannot find configuration URL.” > > If the URL is simply changed to https://twitter.com/PETEandrepete_/status/1788379241815445981 then it downloads perfectly. > > This ONLY happens when AdGuard is running. Disable it and you can now use either x.com or twitter.com URLs. > > A while back I THOUGHT i had nailed this down as being related to DNS Protection, which i had been using at the time. Seems like when I changed it or disabled it the problem went away, however that is not the case as of now. So the only workaround is to change the URL manually. Username: `@petekjohnson` ### Screenshots

comment.body:
Not reproduced with AdGuard filters on my end. Try to leave only them, update the filters, turn other extensions off, clear browser data, restart it, open the site.
If that doesn't help, try to reinstall our extension.
